content.text: NSAIDs such as aspirin can produce a type of allergic response in some patients. Which step, if blocked, is responsible for causing this drug allergy? <image 1>

If NSAIDs such as aspirin block step 4, it would prevent the conversion of arachidonic acid into leukotrienes (LTC4 and LTD4). This blockage can lead to an increase in prostaglandins, which can cause an allergic response in some patients. Therefore, blocking step 4 is responsible for causing this drug allergy.
